subject: Re: [junit] Database for tests using JUnit.
msgSnippet: ... A JUnit test case is just a Java object; nothing special. You can read from files and write to files, just like you would any other Java object. No magic,
messageBody:
>Hello,
>Can someone please explain me the how to create a
>Comma seperated database file which can be given as
>input to A JUnit testcase and the result be redirected
>to another textfile.

A JUnit test case is just a Java object; nothing special. You can read from
files and write to files, just like you would any other Java object. No
magic, here. If you want to know how to read from and write to files in
Java, there are many many tutorials and examples on the web.

By the way, JUnit test cases don't "take input". A JUnit test method simply
creates objects, calls methods and verifies results. In your case, it should
create a Reader and Writer, read from the Reader, write to the Writer and
verify the contents you wrote.

J. B. Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
